title: Donor Lymphocyte Infusion (DLI) Volume
description: Estimates total blood volume to process by apheresis to produce appropriate DLI dosage

parameters.name: donor_total_lymphocytes
parameters.description: Donor total lymphocytes as percentage of WBC

parameters.name: donor_cd3_lymphocytes
parameters.description: Donor CD3+ lymphocytes as percentage of total lymphocytes

result.name: blood_volume_needed
result.description: Total blood volume needed to process by apheresis

ranges.interpretation: Low blood volume requirement. Short apheresis procedure expected. Monitor donor comfort and fluid balance.
Moderate blood volume requirement. Standard apheresis procedure. Ensure adequate donor hydration and monitor vital signs.
High blood volume requirement. Extended apheresis procedure. Consider splitting into multiple sessions. Close monitoring of donor required.
Very high blood volume requirement. Strongly consider multiple apheresis sessions to ensure donor safety. Careful donor selection and monitoring essential.

references: Wingard JR, Hsu J, Hiemenz JW. Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation: A Handbook for Clinicians. 2nd ed. Bethesda, MD: AABB Press; 2010.

Schmitz N, Dreger P, Suttorp M, et al. Primary transplantation of allogeneic peripheral blood progenitor cells mobilized by filgrastim (granulocyte colony-stimulating factor). Blood. 1995 Mar 1;85(5):1666-72.

Kolb HJ, Schattenberg A, Goldman JM, et al. European Group for Blood and Marrow Transplantation Working Party Chronic Leukemia. Graft-versus-leukemia effect of donor lymphocyte transfusions in marrow grafted patients. Blood. 1995 Nov 1;86(5):2041-50.
formula: Total blood volume = (Recipient weight × CD3+ dose × Number of infusions) / (Donor WBC × % Total lymphocytes × % CD3+ lymphocytes × 1000 × Collection efficiency)
notes: Typical DLI goal: 1 dose of 5×10⁷ CD3+ T-cells/kg recipient body weight
Linear correlation exists between CD3+ cells collected and processed blood volume
Used primarily in allogeneic stem cell transplant management for relapsed disease
Consider donor safety limits: maximum 12,000 mL processed blood volume recommended
Higher processed volumes may require multiple apheresis sessions
Donor should meet standard apheresis eligibility criteria
Pre-apheresis CBC and donor screening required
